html:
Updates

** Shares of Rivian Automotive RIVN.O rise as much as 12.2% to $167.51, making the EV maker the third most valuable automaker in the world

** Co on course to gain for a fifth straight session since last week's blockbuster debut

** RIVN market cap stands at ~$140 bln, eclipsing that of Volkswagen (~$123 bln), Ford F.N (~$79 bln) and General Motors (~$91 bln) - Refinitiv data

** Tesla TSLA.O is the world's most valued automaker at ~$1 trln, followed by Toyota 7203.T, valued at ~$305 bln

** Shares of Amazon-backed AMZN.O RIVN up 91.5% from IPO price of $78 last week

** RIVN, which has just started selling EVs, had the world's biggest IPO in 2021, with co's valuation surpassing $100 bln in its Nov. 10 Nasdaq debut (Full Story)

** Rival Lucid Group LCID.O is up 6.5% after upbeat Q3 results, production outlook (Full Story)


(Reporting by Chavi Mehta and Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)

(( Chavi.Mehta@thomsonreuters.com ; Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ))
